title: (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of 1977), hereby order as follows:
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Justice (Delegation of Ministerial
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Justice (Delegation of Ministerial 

Functions) Order 2021.
text_norm: 1 order may cited justice (delegation ministerial functions) order 2021

title: (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of 1977), hereby order as follows:
heading: 2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of
text_raw:
2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of 

the Minister for Justice conferred on her – 

(a) by or under the enactments specified in Part 1 of the Schedule, 

(b) by or under the provisions of the enactments specified in Part 2 

of the Schedule, and 

(c) 

under the Regulations specified in Part 3 of the Schedule, 

are delegated to James Browne, Minister of State at the Department of Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 21st May, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [251] 3
text_norm: 2 power (other power prosecute offence) duty minister justice conferred - (a) enactment specified part 1 schedule (b) provision enactment specified part 2 schedule (c) regulation specified part 3 schedule delegated james browne minister state department justice notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 21st may 2021 251 3

title: (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of 1977), hereby order as follows:
heading: Aliens Act 1935 (No. 14 of 1935)
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Part 1 

Aliens Act 1935 (No. 14 of 1935) 

Betting Acts 1931 to 2015 

Criminal Justice (United Nations Convention against Torture) Act 2000 (No. 11 
of 2000) 

Firearms Acts 1925 to 2009 

Gaming and Lotteries Acts 1956 to 2019 

Illegal Immigrants (Trafficking) Act 2000 (No. 29 of 2000) 

Immigration Act 1999 (No. 22 of 1999) 

Immigration Act 2003 (No. 26 of 2003) 

Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) 

International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66 of 2015), other than section 62 

Irish Nationality and Citizenship Acts 1956 to 2004 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [251] 

Part 2 

Section 88(1) of The Courts of Justice Act 1924 (No. 10 of 1924) 

Section 5 of the Defamation Act 2009 (No. 31 of 2009) 

Part III of the Firearms and Offensive Weapons Act 1990 (No. 12 of 1990) 

Sections 37, 38 and 87 of the Judicial Council Act 2019 (No. 33 of 2019) 

Part 8 of the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 (No. 65 of 2015) 

Sections 16 and 141 of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012 (No. 44 of 2012) 

Section 16 and paragraph 11 of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Private Security 
Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of 2004) 

Section 17 and paragraph 11 of Part 1 of Schedule 5 to the Property Services 
(Regulation) Act 2011 (No. 40 of 2011) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [251] 5 

Part 3 

European Communities (Aliens) Regulations 1977 to 1985 

European Communities (Asylum Procedures) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 51 of 
2011) 

European Communities (Communication of Passenger Data) Regulations 2011 
(S.I. No. 597 of 2011) 

European Communities (Eligibility for Protection) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 
518 of 2006) 

European Communities (Free Movement of Persons) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 
548 of 2015) 

European Communities (Reception Conditions) Regulations 2018 to 2021 

European Communities (Right of Residence for Non-Economically Active 
Persons) Regulations 1977 (S.I. No. 57 of 1997) 

European Union (Dublin System) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 62 of 2018) 

European Union (Subsidiary Protection) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 409 of 
2017) 

European Union (Withdrawal Agreement) (Citizens’ Rights) Regulations 2020 
(S.I. No. 728 of 2020) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [251] 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

18 May, 2021. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [251] 7

title: (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of 1977), hereby order as follows:
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order provides for the delegation of functions of the Minister for Justice 
to James Browne, Minister of State at the Department of Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 8 [251]

ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
